Text: NYISO Technical Bulletin Generator StartUp Cost Guarantee revisedDear Market Participant Technical Bulletin Generator StartUp Cost Guarantee has been revised in response to Market Participant comments and will soon be posted to the NYISO web site For your convenience clean and redlined versions of the Technical Bulletin are attached The purpose of our Technical Bulletins is to facilitate participation in the NYISO by communicating various NYISO concepts techniques and processes to Market Participants before they can be formally documented in a NYISO manual Questions should be directed to your Customer Account Representative or the Help Desk at Regards Peter Lemme NYISO Customer Technical Services See attached file TB redlinepdfSee attached file TB pdf TB redlinepdf TB pdf

NYISO Technical Bulletin Penalties for Persistent UndergenerationDear Market Participant Technical Bulletin Penalties for Persistent Undergeneration is being distributed for Market Participant comment The Technical Bulletin will be posted to the NYISO web site following the comment period Please note that the penalties described in this Technical Bulletin are effective as of October The purpose of our Technical Bulletins is to facilitate participation in the NYISO by communicating various NYISO concepts techniques and processes to Market Participants before they can be formally documented in a NYISO manual Please forward comments on this Technical Bulletin via email by PM on Tuesday October to Peter Lemme NYISO Customer Technical Services See attached file TBdraftpdf TBdraftpdf

NYISO Technical Bulletin Multipass methodology of Security Constrained Unit Commitment revisedthomas PST Dear Market Participant Technical Bulletin Multipass methodology of Security Constrained Unit Commitment was revised to conform with changes resulting from the implementation of virtual bidding For your convenience redlined and clean copies of the revised Technical Bulletin are attached The purpose of our Technical Bulletins is to facilitate participation in the NYISO by communicating various NYISO concepts techniques and processes to Market Participants before they can be formally documented in a NYISO manual If you have any questions please call your Customer Relations representatve or the Help Desk at Peter Lemme NYISO Customer Technical Services See attached file TB revisedpdfSee attached file TB revisedredlinepdf TB revisedpdf TB revisedredlinepdf You are currently subscribed to nyisotie as To unsubscribe send a blank email to

NYISO Technical Bulletin Procedure to apply for CLR ELR classificationDear Market Participant Technical Bulletin Procedure to apply for CLR or ELR classification is being distributed for Market Participant comment The Technical Bulletin will be posted to the NYISO web site following the comment period Please note that comments received will be forwarded to the Generation Issues Task Force GITF for review and discussion The identity of the person company submitting the comment will not be disclosed The purpose of our Technical Bulletins is to facilitate participation in the NYISO by communicating various NYISO concepts techniques and processes to Market Participants before they can be formally documented in a NYISO manual Please forward comments on this Technical Bulletin via email by PM on Friday September to Peter Lemme NYISO Customer Technical Services See attached file TB Apdf TB Apdf

NYISO Opening Technical Bulletin Virtual Bidding in the Day Ahead writes to the NYISOTECHEXCHANGE Discussion List Dear Market Participant Please note that recent NYISO Technical Bulletins were converted to PDF format using Acrobat Anyone experiencing problems opening Technical Bulletin or other recently issued NYISO Technical Bulletins will want to download the current version of Acrobat Reader from the Adobe web site at productsacrobatreadstephtml Peter Lemme NYISO Customer Technical Services

NYISO Technical Bulletin Virtual Bidding in the DayAhead Market revisedDear Market Participant Technical Bulletin Virtual Bidding in the DayAhead Market has been revised in response to Market Participant comments and will soon be posted to the NYISO web site For your convenience clean and redlined versions of the Technical Bulletin are attached Please note that NYISO Technical Bulletins are now converted to PDF format using Acrobat Anyone experiencing problems opening Technical Bulletins will want to download the current version of Acrobat Reader from the Adobe web site at productsacrobatreadstephtml The purpose of our Technical Bulletins is to facilitate participation in the NYISO by communicating various NYISO concepts techniques and processes to Market Participants before they can be formally documented in a NYISO manual Questions should be directed to your Customer Account Representative or the Help Desk at Regards Peter Lemme NYISO Customer Technical Services See attached file TBrevisedredlinepdfSee attached file TBrevisedpdf TBrevisedredlinepdf TBrevisedpdf
